calculation_notes: CQS 1 -> 0% RW per Art. 114
Unrated corporate -> 100% RW per Art. 122
CQS 2 -> 50% RW per Art. 122
UK deviation: CQS 2 -> 30% RW (standard Basel is 50%)
35% RW (LTV 60% <= 80%). CRR uses 35%/75% split at 80% LTV.
Split RW (85% LTV): 37.4%. 35% on portion up to 80% LTV, 75% on excess.
50% RW (LTV 40% <= 50% with income cover)
Retail -> 75% RW per Art. 123
SME factor applied: 0.7619 (Tier 1 only - exposure ≤ £2.2m). NOT available under Basel 3.1.
Senior unsecured, supervisory LGD 45%. Low PD with maturity > 2.5y.
High PD corporate. Correlation decreases at high PD (R→0.12).
Subordinated claim: 75% LGD vs 45% senior. Significantly higher RWA.
50% cash collateral → blended LGD. SME correlation adjustment applied.

description: SME corporate - firm-size adjustment + supporting factor
calculation_notes: SME firm-size adjustment reduces correlation. SME supporting factor 0.7619 applied (Tier 1).
Internal PD 0.01% floored to 0.03% (CRR Art. 163). Floor increases RWA relative to raw PD.
Contractual maturity 7Y capped to 5Y per CRR Art. 162. Maximum maturity adjustment factor.
CRR A-IRB: No LGD floor. Internal LGD 35% vs F-IRB 45%.
Retail must use A-IRB. No maturity adjustment. No LGD floor.
Project finance with A-IRB approval. Alternative: slotting.
Cash 0% haircut. EAD reduced from £1,000,000 to £500,000
CQS 1 govt bond >5y: 4.0% haircut
Main index equity: 15% haircut (other equity: 25%)
Guarantor 30% RW, Borrower 100% RW. Split treatment.
Maturity adjustment: 0.3684. Maturity adj: 0.368 (t=2.0y, T=5.0y)

description: Currency mismatch - GBP exposure, EUR collateral
calculation_notes: FX mismatch: 8% additional haircut
CRR Strong=70% (>=2.5yr), 50% if <2.5yr
CRR Good=90% (>=2.5yr), 70% if <2.5yr
Weak category = 250% RW (punitive)

description: SME Tier 1 only - small exposure (£2m ≤ £2.18m threshold)
calculation_notes: Tier 1 only: exposure £2m ≤ £2.18m threshold. Factor = 0.7619
Blended: £2.18m @ 0.7619 + £1.82m @ 0.85. Effective factor = 0.8019
Tier 2 dominant: £2.18m @ 0.7619 + £7.82m @ 0.85. Effective factor = 0.8308
Retail 75% RW + Tier 1 SME factor. Effective RW = 75% × 0.7619 = 57.14%
Infrastructure factor 0.75 (not tiered). NOT available under Basel 3.1.
Turnover £200m exceeds £44m threshold. No SME factor applies.
At threshold: £2.18m exactly = Tier 1 only. Factor = 0.7619
